segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Despatch Advice document, by means of its name and its number.
DTM, Date/time/period related to the whole message. The DTM segment must be specified at least once to identify the Despatch Advice date.
ALI, A segment indicating that the message is subject to special conditions due to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.
MEA, A segment specifying the weight and volume of the consignment.
MOA, A segment to transmit monetary amounts for the whole despatch required by the consignee to prepare customs clearance procedures.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references where necessary, their dates relating to the whole message, e.g. contract number.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the whole despatch advice message, e.g. purchase orders, delivery instructions, import/export license.
DTM, Date/time/period from the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying names, addresses, locations, and required supporting documents relevant to the whole Despatch Advice.

segment.documentation:
NAD, A segment for identifying names, addresses, and their functions relevant to the whole Despatch Advice. Identification of the parties involved is recommended for the Despatch Advice message, and is to be given in the NAD segment.
It is recommended that where possible, only the coded form of the party ID should be specified, e.g. the buyer and seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required. The consignee or delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.
LOC, A segment indicating more details regarding specific places/locations related to the party specified in the NAD segment, e.g. internal site/building number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving references relevant only to the specified party rather than the whole message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for referencing documents relating to the party specified by the NAD segment.
DTM, A segment for specifying Date/time/period of the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify the people, functions, departments and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function or department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify communication types and numbers for the person, function or department identified in the CTA.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments indicating terms of delivery.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment indicating the terms of delivery and transfer for the whole despatch advice.
LOC, A segment indicating locations relevant to the TOD segment.
FTX, Additional free text pertinent to terms of delivery. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments specifying details of the mode, means and method of transport and date/time of departure and destination relevant to the whole despatch advice.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods being despatched.
PCD, A segment specifying the percentage of utilization of the capacity of the means of transport.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for a despatch.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments giving the location and date/time information relative to the transportation.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating locations relevant to the transport specified in the TDT segment.
DTM, A segment giving the date/time/period information of departure and/or arrival of the transported goods for the specified location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments providing information relative to the equipment used for the transportation of goods relevant to the whole despatch advice.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to define fixed information regarding equipment used in conjunction with the whole despatch advice, and if required, to indicate responsibility for supply of the equipment.
MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of equipment described in the EQD segment.
SEL, A segment specifying a seal number connected to a specific equipment named in the EQD.

EQA, A segment identifying equipment either attached to the equipment described in the EQD segment above, or equipment related to that described in the EQD segment, and which is further defined in a subsequent EQD segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments providing information on hazardous goods and their handling.

segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on handling and notification of hazardous materials in the specified equipment.

FTX, A segment with free text information in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, for hazardous material. 4.1.2 Detail section Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments providing details of all package levels and of the individual despatched items contained in the consignment. This segment group provides the capability to give the hierarchical packing relationships. The group defines a logical top-down order structure. The lowest level package information of the hierarchy is followed by the detail product information.

segment.documentation: CPS, A segment identifying the sequence in which packing of the consignment occurs, e.g. boxes loaded onto a pallet.

FTX, A segment with free text information in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, as to the packing sequence.
In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
QVR, A segment identifying a quantity variance and reason for the variance.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments identifying packaging, physical dimensions, marks and numbers, quantities, date and time information, handling information and information about packing at this level.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number and type of the packages/physical units and the physical type of packaging for the despatched goods.
MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of the packages/physical units described in the PAC segment.
QTY, A segment to specify the quantity per package described in the PAC segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments providing information on hazardous goods and handling.

segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling and notification of hazardous materials in the specified package.
FTX, A segment with free text information in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, for hazardous materials.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments specifying markings, labels, and packing numbers.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and/or labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.
RFF, A segment for referencing the package identification e.g. master label number.
DTM, A segment for specifying date/time/period related to the document referenced.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to give specific package related identifications and dates.

segment.documentation: GIR, To specify a set of related identification numbers.
DTM, A segment to give specific dates of a package, e.g. production date, etc.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments giving package identification numbers and, where relevant, delivery limitation information.

segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing the identity numbers of packages being despatched.
DLM, A segment to identify any limitation on delivery of goods, e.g. hold until final approval by supplier.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: NAD-TDT-TMD-HAN-FTX-MOA-SG17-SG18-SG19- SG20-SG21-SG24 A group of segments providing details of the individual despatched items.

segment.documentation:
LIN, A segment identifying the product being despatched.
All other segments in the detail section following the LIN segment refer to that line item.
PIA, A segment providing additional product identification.
IMD, A segment for describing the product being despatched. This segment should be used for products that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.
MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of the despatched item in original or unpacked form.
QTY, A segment to give quantity information concerning the product.
ALI, A segment indicating that the line item is subject to special conditions due to origin, customs preference, or commercial factors.
GIN, A segment providing identity numbers of the goods being despatched, e.g. serial numbers for assembled equipment.
GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a line item, e.g. engine number, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.
DLM, A segment to identify any limitation on delivery of goods e.g. hold until final approval by supplier.
DTM, A segment providing date, time information related to the line item, e.g. production date.
NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant to the item, e.g. manufacturer.
TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods being despatched, e.g. shipment/consignment number, shipping method, carrier.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for a despatched item.
HAN, A segment providing information on the handling and notification of hazardous materials.

FTX, A segment with free text information in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, to the line item. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
MOA, A segment giving monetary amounts required by the consignee to undertake customs clearance procedures.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments to give reference numbers and dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying documents related to the line item.
NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant to the originator of the document in the RFF segment.
CTA, A segment to identify the office, branch or department to whom communication relevant to the document should be directed.
DTM, A segment for date/time/period relative to the referred document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments giving information about dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods.
QTY, A segment to specify quantity of the given dangerous goods.
FTX, A segment to describe dangerous goods.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments giving location information and where relevant, additional addresses, date and time, and quantities.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment identifying a specific location to which products will be delivered.

NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant to the delivery point.
It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified, e.g. the buyer and seller are known to each other, thus only the coded ID is required. The consignee or delivery address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.
DTM, A segment providing date/time information relevant for delivery to the specific location.
QTY, A segment to specify quantity for the given location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments indicating the split placement of packages or unpacked goods into equipment.

segment.documentation: SGP, A segment to specify the placement of goods in relation to one equipment. If goods are unpacked, their quantity would be given in the following QTY segment.
QTY, A segment to specify the quantity of unpacked goods being placed in a specific equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments identifying one specific package or a number of packages, their marks and numbers, measurements, quantities, date and time information and handling instructions.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying marking and labels used on individual packages or a range of packages.
DTM, A segment giving the date/time details related to the goods within the packages e.g. expiration date.
MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages.
QTY, A segment to specify quantity per package.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments giving package identification numbers and, where relevant, delivery limitation information.

segment.documentation: GIN, A segment providing identification numbers being applied to the packages despatched.
DLM, A segment to identify any limitation on delivery of goods e.g. hold until final approval by supplier.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segment providing information on hazardous materials and handling.

segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on handling and notification of hazardous materials.
FTX, A segment with free text information in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, for hazardous materials.
GIN, A segment providing identification numbers being applied to the packages containing hazardous goods.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments identifying quantity variances, the reason for the variance, and, when relevant, date and time information.

segment.documentation: QVR, A segment identifying a quantity variance and the reason for the variance.

DTM, A segment to give date and time information relative to the quantity variances, e.g. proposed delivery date on the back order. 4.1.3 Summary section Information to be provided in the Summary section:
CNT, A segment by which control totals may be provided by sender for checking by the receiver.
